gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.19/hour reflects constrained supply chains driving capex inflation, as GPU scarcity forces hyperscalers to pay premium rates for critical AI compute capacity.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.25/1M signals intense API price competition, with providers racing to optimize efficiency and pass savings to customers while maintaining model quality differentiation.

gagl.text: 120 TWh annual load creates severe grid strain, making nuclear baseload power increasingly essential to meet AI infrastructure's relentless energy demands while reducing carbon footprint.

aipi.text: The industry's explosive growth trajectory faces sustainability headwinds from soaring compute costs and energy consumption, creating bubble risks as capex requirements outpace revenue growth.
